intro: Crepidiastrum akagii, commonly known as the Japanese arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive spatulate leaves and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, with a central spadix surrounded by a broad, arrow-shaped spathe. Crepidiastrum akagii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
